text:
Raskolnikov’s heart raced in the dim yard.  
Sonia’s presence felt eternal, comforting.  
“I can’t escape this fate,” he thought.  

---  

Stairs cluttered with rubbish, memories flooded back.  
“Why am I here?” he wondered, breathless.  
“If I must drink the cup...”  

---  

Cold sweat dripped as he reached the door.  
“Just get it over with,” he urged himself.  
“Only the lieutenant awaits.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov feels the weight of his fate as he prepares to confront a pivotal moment in his life, reflecting on his connection to Sonia and the inevitability of his actions.
